skill.name: x-article-publisher
skill.description: Publish Markdown articles to X (Twitter) Articles editor with proper formatting. Use when user wants to publish a Markdown file/URL to X Articles, or mentions "publish to X", "post article to Twitter", "X article", or wants help with X Premium article publishing. Handles cover image upload and converts Markdown to rich text automatically.
skill.summary: Publish Markdown articles to X (Twitter) Articles editor with proper formatting. Use when user wants...
skill.author: wshuyi

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate content publishing skill with two Python scripts for Markdown parsing and clipboard operations. Both scripts only access user-specified files via command-line arguments, perform no network requests, no command execution, and no sensitive data access. All 103 static findings are false positives: argparse parsers were misidentified as cryptographic algorithms, and markdown code formatting was misidentified as shell execution.

content.value_statement: Converts Markdown files to rich text and publishes them to X (Twitter) Articles. Automates the workflow of parsing content, uploading images, and formatting for the X Articles editor.
actual_capabilities: Parse Markdown files and extract title, images, and content
Convert Markdown to HTML for rich text paste
Copy images and HTML to system clipboard
Insert images at precise positions using block index
Compress images before uploading for better performance
limitations: Requires Playwright MCP for browser automation
Only saves as draft, never auto-publishes

use_cases.title: Publish blog posts
use_cases.description: Convert Markdown blog posts and publish them to X Articles with full formatting preserved

use_cases.title: Share documentation
use_cases.description: Publish technical documentation with code blocks and images to X Articles

use_cases.title: Cross-post articles
use_cases.description: Transform existing Markdown content into X Articles format for broader reach

prompt_templates.title: Basic publish
prompt_templates.prompt: Publish the Markdown file at [path_to_file] to X Articles

prompt_templates.title: With custom images
prompt_templates.prompt: Publish [markdown_file] with [image_path] as the cover image to X Articles

prompt_templates.title: Draft workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Parse [article.md] and prepare it for X Articles, then save it as a draft

prompt_templates.title: Multi-image article
prompt_templates.prompt: Publish [long_article.md] to X Articles. Make sure to insert all content images at their correct positions.

output_examples.input: Publish my article.md to X Articles
Convert this technical documentation to an X Article
output: Converted code blocks to blockquote format

best_practices: Always verify the draft before publishing manually
Insert images in reverse order of block_index to maintain positioning
Use image compression (--quality 85) for faster uploads
anti_patterns: Do not try to publish directly without reviewing the draft first
Do not skip the Markdown parsing step before editing
Do not insert images in ascending block_index order

faq.question: Which platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code when Playwright MCP is available.

faq.question: What are the size limits for X Articles?
faq.answer: X Articles have a content length limit. Very long articles may need to be split across multiple posts.

faq.question: How does it integrate with the browser?
faq.answer: It uses Playwright MCP tools for navigation, clicks, file uploads, and keyboard shortcuts.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only accesses files you explicitly specify and never sends data to external servers.

faq.question: Why is my image upload failing?
faq.answer: Ensure the image path is correct and the file exists. Use absolute paths for best results.

faq.question: How is this different from manual publishing?
faq.answer: Automates Markdown parsing, image positioning, and clipboard operations for faster publishing.
